is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.

member.name: T:Triamec.Acquisitions.Slope
member.summary: Defines when a sample is let through.

member.name: F:Triamec.Acquisitions.Slope.Default
member.summary: Lets data through unconditionally.

member.name: F:Triamec.Acquisitions.Slope.Raising
member.summary: Lets data through as soon as it crosses a specified level with a raising slope.

member.name: F:Triamec.Acquisitions.Slope.Falling
member.summary: Lets data through as soon as it crosses a specified level with a falling slope.

member.name: F:Triamec.Acquisitions.Slope.Any
member.summary: Lets data through as soon as it crosses a specified level with a falling or raising slope.

member.name: F:Triamec.Acquisitions.Slope.Equal
member.summary: Lets data through as soon as it reaches a specified level.

member.name: F:Triamec.Acquisitions.Slope.NotEqual
member.summary: Lets data through as soon as it leaves a specified level.

This flavor makes selection possible in one click, but uses more space.

member.summary: Changes the start time and the interval between method invocations for a timer, using 32-bit signed integers to measure time intervals.
member.param: The amount of time to delay before the invoking the callback method specified when the was constructed, in milliseconds. Specify to prevent the timer from restarting. Specify zero (0) to restart the timer immediately.
The time interval between invocations of the callback method specified when the was constructed, in milliseconds. Specify to disable periodic signaling.
member.returns: true if the timer was successfully updated; otherwise, false.
member.exception: The or parameter is negative and is not equal to .

member.name: M:Triamec.Threading.MarshallingTimer.Change(System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Changes the start time and the interval between method invocations for a timer, using values to measure time intervals.
member.param: A representing the amount of time to delay before invoking the callback method specified when the was constructed. Specify negative one (-1) milliseconds to prevent the timer from restarting. Specify zero (0) to restart the timer immediately.
The time interval between invocations of the callback method specified when the was constructed. Specify negative one (-1) milliseconds to disable periodic signaling.
member.returns: true if the timer was successfully updated; otherwise, false.
member.exception: The or parameter, in milliseconds, is less than -1.
The or parameter, in milliseconds, is greater than 4294967294.

member.summary: This method overrides the procedure that responds to Windows messages. It intercepts the WM_MOUSEMOVE message and ignores it if is and the does not contain the focus. Otherwise, it calls the base class procedure to handle the message. It also intercepts the WM_MOUSEACTIVATE message and replaces a MA_ACTIVATEANDEAT result with a MA_ACTIVATE result if is .
member.param: The Windows to process.
